net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.querybuilder

Class DeletionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.querybuilder.QueryBuilder<DeletionBuilder,java.lang.Integer>
      • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.querybuilder.DeletionBuilder

  • public class DeletionBuilder
extends QueryBuilder<DeletionBuilder,java.lang.Integer>
    Builds a SQLite DELETE query.

    Examples

    Delete all records from a table: 
     int nDeleted = QueryBuilder.deleteFrom( sTableName )
     .deleteAll()
     .executeOn( db )
     ;
    Delete select records from a table: 
     int nDeleted = QueryBuilder.deleteFrom( sTableName )
     .where( "active=? OR last_active_ts<=?",
         QueryBuilder.WHERE_FALSE, SQLitePortal.now() - 86400 )
     .executeOn( db )
     ;
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.1 (#20)
    See Also:
    SQLiteDatabase.delete(String, String, String[])

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DELETE_FAILED
      Similar to the standard magic number returned when an insertion query fails (see SQLitePortal.INSERT_FAILED, this return value from executeOn(SQLiteDatabase) indicates that the delete operation could not be carried out because of an exception.
      protected static java.lang.String LOG_TAG 
      protected static java.lang.String SQL_DELETE_FROM

    • Field Detail

      • LOG_TAG

        protected static final java.lang.String LOG_TAG

      • DELETE_FAILED

        public static final int DELETE_FAILED
        Similar to the standard magic number returned when an insertion query fails (see SQLitePortal.INSERT_FAILED, this return value from executeOn(SQLiteDatabase) indicates that the delete operation could not be carried out because of an exception.

        Specified by:
        executeOn in class QueryBuilder<DeletionBuilder,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
